The Last of Us 2 represents how games sh: I honestly don’t get the negativity behind this game\, I’ve just finished playing and honestly\, I cried many manly tears. When Joel died the way he did I was angry\, sad and just confused\, I didn’t know how to react and seeing Ellie just as this broken girl trying to grieve the passing of the only father figure she had in her life was truly heartbreaking to watch and play through.The character development in this game is amazing because I went from hating Abby and the rest of the members of the knockoff Fireflies to actually liking them and hating the fact that they died\, it’s safe to say playing this game is probably what it feels to have Bipolar\, one minute I’m sad\, one minute I’m happy and the next I’m pissed off by something that’s happened.I almost lobbed my controller when Abby shot Tommy\, I honestly thought she killed him\, and I wasn’t ready for that to happen\, not quite yet anyways.I want to talk about the ending as that’s where people seem to be annoyed about the most which honestly I can kind of understand but the way I look at it is this\, Ellie has lost everything\, she has lost friends\, she has lost her family\, she has lost everything and now she is alone\, I feel like she realised that she related to Abby at that moment when she was drowning her at sea and it was at that point Ellie simply\, gave up. She saw that she would be no better than Abby in that situation\, and I honestly love that ending\, I would love to be able to play as Abby again if there is a third game which I honestly hope that’s there is. They left the game on a (somewhat) cliffhanger\, Ellie arrives back home to find out that Dina has up and left with little baby JJ.
